name: Baby's Breath
climate: Thrives in temperate climates and can tolerate mild seasonal variations.
Prefers environments with moderate humidity and consistent temperatures.
Can suffer in extreme heat or cold, needing regular care in such climates.
Not suitable for tropical climates; requires cooler, drier conditions.
sunlight: Requires full sun exposure for at least six hours a day to bloom well.
Can tolerate partial shade, but flowering may be significantly reduced.
Insufficient sunlight may lead to leggy growth and fewer blooms.
Avoid deep shade conditions, as it critically impacts plant health.
watering: Prefers well-drained soil and does not require frequent watering.
Overwatering can lead to root rot; keep moisture consistent but not soggy.
Infrequent but deep watering is better than shallow, regular watering.
Ensure soil dries out between waterings to maintain plant health.
soil: Prefers alkaline to neutral soil pH for optimal growth conditions.
Soil should be well-draining, ideally sandy or loamy textures.
Avoid heavy, clay-based soil as it can retain too much moisture.
Enrich soil with compost to improve nutrient content and drainage.
toxic: Mildly toxic if ingested by pets like cats and dogs, causing irritation.
Contact with the plant may cause minor skin irritation in sensitive individuals.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent flowers can promote more prolonged blooming periods.
Pruning encourages bushier growth and prevents legginess in stems.
